intro: Cardiagyris rugulosa, commonly known as the rough leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are rough and lobed, while its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Cardiagyris rugulosa is often considered a weed but can serve as a food source for various pollinators.
